page.title: 05Recreation in West Bromwich
page.content: Although the area is predominately urban and residential, including West Bromwich town centre,almost half of the twelve square kilometres is designated "Green Belt "land. Called the Sandwell Valley , this area provides unique leisure opportunities for local residents and for visitors. There are four eighteen hole golf courses, a nature reserve and trail, a water sport centre and a municipal park. Linked to the nature reserve is a Royal Society for the Protection of Birds Study Centre. The ruins of the 12th century Sandwell Priory provide archaeological interest .Dartmouth Park includes eight tennis courts,a miniature golf course and many football and cricket pitches. There is also a paddling pool and boating lake. Special annual functions include the volleyball tournament and the fair.
